paper_abstract: We define quittable consensus, a natural variation of the consensus problem, where processes have the option to agree on "quit" if failures occur, and we relate this problem to the well-known problem of nonblocking atomic commit. We then determine the weakest failure detectors for these two problems in all environments, regardless of the number of faulty processes.
paper_title: THE WEAKEST FAILURE DETECTORS TO SOLVE QUITTABLE CONSENSUS AND NONBLOCKING ATOMIC COMMIT
